New Records: Spencer Torkelson hit his eighth home run of the season.
Riley Greene hit his 20th home run of the season for the first time.
Key Match Events: Brant Hurter induced a first-pitch double play for the first time in his 20-year baseball career.
Riley Greene hit a two-run home run in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers were struggling with their starting pitchers due to trades and injuries, leading to Brant Hurter stepping up.
The Red Sox's strategy involved using Cooper Criswell to get outs and then taking advantage of matchups, which didn't work out.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch highlighted the team's ability to react to the Red Sox's strategy and take advantage of opportunities.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora noted the team's offensive struggles and the lack of hard hits.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Comerica Park with a crowd of 30,173 fans.
Brant Hurter had a 3.25 ERA in six games, including one start.
The Tigers trailed the Red Sox by a half-game in the AL wild-card race after the series win.
Others: The Tigers honored their 1984 championship team before the game, which included a World Series victory over the Padres.
